properties.value: Sanfew serum is a potion found in the Last Man Standing minigame that combines the properties of super restore, superantipoison, and Relicym's balm potions (though, unlike the latter, will provide fifteen minutes of immunity to disease when consumed). The duration of the antipoison lasts six minutes, the same time as a superantipoison does. The restore value obtained per dose is 4 + 30% of the player's base level (round down) in each of the affected skills. Unlike normal Sanfew serums, these lack an "Empty" option.

Sanfew serum is a potion found in the Last Man Standing minigame that combines the properties of super restore, superantipoison, and Relicym's balm potions (though, unlike the latter, will provide fifteen minutes of immunity to disease when consumed). The duration of the antipoison lasts six minutes, the same time as a superantipoison does. The restore value obtained per dose is 4 + 30% of the player's base level (round down) in each of the affected skills. Unlike normal Sanfew serums, these lack an "Empty" option.

Effects[edit | edit source]

Stat restore is calculated with: ⌊ S k i l l L e v e l × 3 10 ⌋ + 4 {\displaystyle \lfloor SkillLevel\times {\frac {3}{10}}\rfloor +4}

Level Boost Level Boost Level Boost

4-6 +5 37-39 +15 70-73 +25
7-9 +6 40-43 +16 74-76 +26
10-13 +7 44-46 +17 77-79 +27
14-16 +8 47-49 +18 80-83 +28
17-19 +9 50-53 +19 84-86 +29
20-23 +10 54-56 +20 87-89 +30
24-26 +11 57-59 +21 90-93 +31
27-29 +12 60-63 +22 94-96 +32
30-33 +13 64-66 +23 97-99 +33

'''Sanfew serum''' is a potion found in the [[Last Man Standing]] [[minigame]] that combines the properties of [[super restore]], [[superantipoison]], and [[Relicym's balm]] [[potions]] (though, unlike the latter, will provide fifteen minutes of immunity to [[disease]] when consumed). The duration of the antipoison lasts six minutes, the same time as a superantipoison does. The restore value obtained per dose is 4 + 30% of the player's base level (round down) in each of the affected skills. Unlike normal [[Sanfew serum]]s, these lack an "Empty" option.

==Effects==
Stat restore is calculated with: <math>\lfloor SkillLevel \times \frac{3}{10} \rfloor + 4</math>
